verses.verse: For the Lord<WH3068> will have mercy<WH7355> on Jacob<WH3290>, and will yet choose<WH977> Israel<WH3478>, and set<WH3240> them in their own land<WH127>: and the strangers<WH1616> shall be joined<WH3867> with them<WH5596>, and they shall cleave to the house<WH1004> of Jacob<WH3290>.

And the people<WH5971> shall take<WH3947> them<WH935>, and bring them to their place<WH4725>: and the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478> shall possess<WH5157> them in the land<WH127> of the Lord<WH3068> for servants<WH5650> and handmaids<WH8198>: and they shall take them captives<WH7617>, whose captives<WH7617> they were<WH7287>; and they shall rule over their oppressors<WH5065>.

And it shall come to pass in the day<WH3117> that the Lord<WH3068> shall give you rest<WH5117> from your sorrow<WH6090>, and from your fear<WH7267>, and from the hard<WH7186> bondage<WH5656> where you were made to serve<WH5647>,
That you shall take up<WH5375> this proverb<WH4912> against the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>, and say<WH559>, How has the oppressor<WH5065> ceased<WH7673>! the golden city<WH4062> ceased<WH7673>!
The Lord<WH3068> has broken<WH7665> the staff<WH4294> of the wicked<WH7563>, and the scepter<WH7626> of the rulers<WH4910>.

He who struck<WH5221> the people<WH5971> in wrath<WH5678> with a continual<WH1115> stroke<WH4347>, he that ruled<WH7287> the nations<WH1471> in anger<WH639>, is persecuted<WH4783>, and none<WH1097> hinders<WH2820>.
The whole earth<WH776> is at rest<WH5117>, and is quiet<WH8252>: they break forth<WH6476> into singing<WH7440>.
Yes<WH1265>, the fir trees rejoice<WH8055> at you<WH730>, and the cedars of Lebanon<WH3844>, saying<WH7901>, Since you are laid down, no lumberjack<WH3772> is come up against us<WH5927>.

Hell<WH7585> from beneath is moved<WH7264> for you to meet<WH7125> you at your coming<WH935>: it stirs up<WH5782> the dead<WH7496> for you<WH6260>, even all the chief ones of the earth<WH776>; it has raised up<WH6965> from their thrones<WH3678> all the kings<WH4428> of the nations<WH1471>.
All they shall speak<WH6030> and say<WH559> unto you<WH2470>, Are you also become weak as we<WH4911>? are you become like unto us?
Your pomp<WH1347> is brought down<WH3381> to the grave<WH7585>, and the noise<WH1998> of your violas<WH5035>: the worm<WH7415> is spread<WH3331> under you<WH8438>, and the worms cover you<WH4374>.
How are you fallen<WH5307> from heaven<WH8064>, O Lucifer<WH1966>, son<WH1121> of the morning<WH7837>! how are you cut down<WH1438> to the ground<WH776>, which did weaken<WH2522> the nations<WH1471>!

For you have said<WH559> in your heart<WH3824>, I will ascend<WH5927> into heaven<WH8064>, I will exalt<WH7311> my throne<WH3678> above<WH4605> the stars<WH3556> of God<WH410>: I will sit<WH3427> also upon the mountain<WH2022> of the congregation<WH4150>, in the sides<WH3411> of the north<WH6828>:
I will ascend<WH5927> above the heights<WH1116> of the clouds<WH5645>; I will be like<WH1819> the most High<WH5945>.
Yet you shall be brought down<WH3381> to hell<WH7585>, to the sides<WH3411> of the pit<WH953>.

They that see<WH7200> you shall narrowly look<WH7688> upon you<WH995>, and consider you<WH376>, saying, Is this the man that made the earth<WH776> to tremble<WH7264>, that did shake<WH7493> kingdoms<WH4467>;
That made<WH7760> the world<WH8398> as a wilderness<WH4057>, and destroyed<WH2040> the cities<WH5892> there<WH6605>; that opened not the house<WH1004> of his prisoners<WH615>?
All the kings<WH4428> of the nations<WH1471>, even all of them<WH7901>, lie in glory<WH3519>, every one<WH376> in his own house<WH1004>.

But you are cast out<WH7993> of your grave<WH6913> like a abominable<WH8581> branch<WH5342>, and as the clothes<WH3830> of those that are slain<WH2026>, thrust through<WH2944> with a sword<WH2719>, that go down<WH3381> to the stones<WH68> of the pit<WH953>; as a carcass<WH6297> trodden under feet<WH947>.

You shall not be joined<WH3161> with them in burial<WH6900>, because you have destroyed<WH7843> your land<WH776>, and slain<WH2026> your people<WH5971>: the seed<WH2233> of evildoers<WH7489> shall never<WH5769> be renowned<WH7121>.

Prepare<WH3559> slaughter<WH4293> for his sons<WH1121> for the iniquity<WH5771> of their fathers<WH1>; that they do not<WH1077> rise<WH6965>, nor possess<WH3423> the land<WH776>, nor fill<WH4390> the face<WH6440> of the world<WH8398> with cities<WH6145>.

For I will rise up<WH6965> against them<WH5002>, says the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, and cut off<WH3772> from Babylon<WH894> the name<WH8034>, and remnant<WH7605>, and son<WH5209>, and nephew<WH5220>, says<WH5002> the Lord<WH3068>.

I will also make<WH7760> it a possession<WH4180> for the bittern<WH7090>, and pools<WH98> of water<WH4325>: and I will sweep<WH2894> it with the broom<WH4292> of destruction<WH8045>, says<WH5002> the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>.
The Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> has sworn<WH7650>, saying<WH559>, Surely as I have thought<WH1819>, so shall it come to pass<WH3289>; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand<WH6965>:

That I will break<WH7665> the Assyrian<WH804> in my land<WH776>, and upon my mountains<WH2022> tread him under foot<WH947>: then shall his yoke<WH5923> depart<WH5493> from off them<WH5448>, and his burden depart<WH5493> from off their shoulders<WH7926>.
This is the purpose<WH6098> that is purposed<WH3289> upon the whole earth<WH776>: and this is the hand<WH3027> that is stretched out<WH5186> upon all the nations<WH1471>.
For the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> has purposed<WH3289>, and who shall annul<WH6565> it<WH3027>? and his hand is stretched out<WH5186>, and who shall turn it back<WH7725>?
In the year<WH8141> that king<WH4428> Ahaz<WH271> died<WH4194> was this burden<WH4853>.

Rejoice<WH8055> not you<WH6429>, whole Palestina, because the rod<WH7626> of him that struck<WH5221> you is broken<WH7665>: for out of the serpent<WH5175>'s root<WH8328> shall come forth<WH3318> a adder<WH6848>, and his fruit<WH6529> shall be a fiery<WH8314> flying<WH5774> serpent<WH8314>.

And the firstborn<WH1060> of the poor<WH1800> shall feed<WH7462>, and the needy<WH34> shall lie down<WH7257> in safety<WH983>: and I will kill<WH4191> your root<WH8328> with famine<WH7458>, and he shall kill<WH2026> your remnant<WH7611>.

Howl<WH3213>, O gate<WH8179>; cry<WH2199>, O city<WH5892>; you<WH6429>, whole Palestina, are dissolved<WH4127>: for there shall come<WH935> from the north<WH6828> a smoke<WH6227>, and none shall be alone<WH909> in his appointed times<WH4151>.

What shall one then answer<WH6030> the messengers<WH4397> of the nation<WH1471>? That the Lord<WH3068> has founded<WH3245> Zion<WH6726>, and the poor<WH6041> of his people<WH5971> shall trust in it<WH2620>.
